alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln; Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 20 at 2:32PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Flash Flooding and River Flooding Possible Tuesday through Friday across the Tennessee Valley... Several rounds of heavy rainfall are expected this week as a series of disturbances impact the region. Thunderstorms are also expected during this time period which will locally increase rainfall amounts. Flash flooding will be possible during heavy downpours and in locations where training of heavy showers and thunderstorms occurs. Additionally, several days of rainfall will also lead to rises on area rivers, creeks, and streams. River flooding will be possible, especially on the tributaries of the mainstem Tennessee River. Rainfall totals Monday night through Wednesday could reach 1 to 3 inches, with another 1 to 2 inches possible Thursday into Friday. It is important to note that these values may change depending on exactly where a front stalls and its possible these numbers could change in later forecasts. A Flood Watch may be required for portions of northern Alabama and southern middle Tennessee for later this week. Residents should continue to monitor this unfolding weather situation and stay tuned to further forecast updates from the National Weather Service. For additional hydrologic information, visit our website at weather.gov/huntsville.
